item.title: Calling
item.dc:creator: @Nets8 Nets8
item.description:
@Nets8 wrote:

I don’t know what Yz is talking about. What file do you want to call it from?

Read full topic

item.title: Calling
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“surfer25, post:5, topic:171430”][quote author=Yz85Racer link=topic=231449.msg1981499#msg1981499 date=1199638059]

so would it be
passwordGenerator.main();

Yes… Though you should refrain from calling the main class. Try to use perhaps a method.
E.g the main method;
public static void main(String[] args) {
new PasswordGenerator(this).doFukHax();
}

public void doFukHax();
System.out.println(this.getNext());
}

And then call it directly, e.g
PasswordGenerator.doFukHax();

Though, accessing it via a static reference will require the static modifier…
[/quote]

Ok thanks
(again)[/quote]
You’re welcome. Sorry we had to discuss it with all the spamming going on.

Read full topic

item.title: Calling

item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“surfer25, post:3, topic:171430”]so would it be
passwordGenerator.main();[/quote]
Yes… Though you should refrain from calling the main class. Try to use perhaps a method.
E.g the main method;
public static void main(String[] args) {
new PasswordGenerator(this).doFukHax();
}

public void doFukHax();
System.out.println(this.getNext());
}

And then call it directly, e.g
PasswordGenerator.doFukHax();

Though, accessing it via a static reference will require the static modifier…
